post.title: From Frontend Developer to Principle Software Engineer
post.description: I recently joined a European public company as Lead Software Engineer. The role has a combined responsibility of Principle Software Engineer and Senior Engineering Manager. It is as challenging as it sounds. I want to share with you 50+ books and resources that help me in my journey.

body.raw: My journey is a bit of a bumpy one and full of learnings. I'm so grateful for the experience and the people that help me along the way. I recently joined a European public company as Lead Software Engineer. The role is part of the leadership model in the company with a responsibility of Principle Software Engineer and Senior Engineering Manager. It's as challenging as it sounds to shift from being an individual contributor to having a duo responsibility, but I was prepared. I want to share all the resources that have a tremendous impact on my road to tech leadership with you. My hope is that regardless of your background or where you are in your career, some of these resources here can help unblock you or offer you inspiration when you need them. ## TL;DR - üëØ Value relationships. Not just with others, but with yourself too. - üöÄ Find your leadership style. It multiplies your impact. - ü¶Ñ Stay true to your craft. It's the cornerstone of your value proposition. --- ## Valuing Relationships Your relationship with yourself is as important, if not more, as your relationships with others. After I found my center, I noticed a clarity to communicate authentically. It helps me discuss without arguing from ego, and provide candid feedback during and 1:1s the my peers and talents. I'm able to form more meaningful relationships and communicate more effectively. #### The books that helps me understand myself - [The Chimp Paradox: The Acclaimed Mind Management Programme to Help You Achieve Success, Confidence and Happiness](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/12228097-the-chimp-paradox) by Steve Peters - [Quiet](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/8520610-quiet) by Susan Cain - [Outliers: The Story of Success](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3228917-outliers) by Malcolm Gladwell - [Grit](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/27213329-grit) by Angela Duckworth - [How Champions Think: In Sports and in Life](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/25305085-how-champions-think) by Bob Rotella, and Bob Cullen (Contributor) - [Mindset: The New Psychology of Success](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/40745.Mindset) by Carol S. Dweck - [Daring Greatly: How the Courage to Be Vulnerable Transforms the Way We Live, Love, Parent, and Lead](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/13588356-daring-greatly) by Bren√© Brown - [The Willpower Instinct: How Self-Control Works, Why It Matters, and What You Can Do to Get More of It](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/10865206-the-willpower-instinct) by Kelly McGonigal #### The books that helps me stay consistent - [Atomic Habits: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/40121378-atomic-habits) by James Clear - [The Headspace Guide to Meditation & Mindfulness](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/27414493-the-headspace-guide-to-meditation-mindfulness) by Andy Puddicombe - [The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up: The Japanese Art of Decluttering and Organizing](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/22318578-the-life-changing-magic-of-tidying-up) by Marie Kond≈ç - [The Power of Habit: Why We Do What We Do in Life and Business](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/12609433-the-power-of-habit) by Charles Duhigg - [Why We Sleep: Unlocking the Power of Sleep and Dreams](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/34466963-why-we-sleep) by Matthew Walker #### The resources that helps me stay consistent - [Huberman Lab](https://hubermanlab.com/) - [Headspace](https://www.headspace.com/) #### The books that helps me forming meaningful relationship with others - [The Chimp Paradox: The Acclaimed Mind Management Programme to Help You Achieve Success, Confidence and Happiness](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/12228097-the-chimp-paradox) by Steve Peters - [Radical Candor: Be a Kickass Boss Without Losing Your Humanity](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/29939161-radical-candor) by Kim Malone Scott - [Daring Greatly: How the Courage to Be Vulnerable Transforms the Way We Live, Love, Parent, and Lead](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/13588356-daring-greatly) by Bren√© Brown - [15 Commitments of Conscious Leadership](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/23275060-15-commitments-of-conscious-leadership) by Jim Dethmer, Diana Chapman, Kaley Warner Klemp ## Finding Your Style It's important to think about scaling your influence and impact early on. As I get more years under my belt, the bigger projects I'm involved in. More teams, higher stakes, longer time budgets, higher complexities. My focus turned to how to empower all parties involved to iterate and deliver fast, and at the same time be helpful in alignment on tech excellence. The goal is to build better and faster than I can by myself. #### The books that helps me find my leadership foundation - [15 Commitments of Conscious Leadership](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/23275060-15-commitments-of-conscious-leadership) by Jim Dethmer, Diana Chapman, Kaley Warner Klemp - [No Rules Rules: Netflix and the Culture of Reinvention](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/49099937-no-rules-rules) by Reed Hastings, Erin Meyer - [Discover Your True North](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/25957932-discover-your-true-north) by Bill George, David Gergen (Foreword) - [Extreme Ownership: How U.S. Navy SEALs Lead and Win](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/23848190-extreme-ownership) by Jocko Willink, Leif Babin - [Trillion Dollar Coach: The Leadership Playbook of Silicon Valley's Bill Campbell](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/42118073-trillion-dollar-coach) by Eric Schmidt, Jonathan Rosenberg, Alan Eagle - [The One Thing: The Surprisingly Simple Truth Behind Extraordinary Results](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/16256798-the-one-thing) by Gary Keller, Jay Papasan - [Principles: Life and Work](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/34536488-principles) by Ray Dalio - [Inspired: How to Create Tech Products Customers Love](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/35249663-inspired?ac=1&from_search=true&qid=1o6CU5ZS61&rank=2) by Marty Cagan ## Staying True to Craft It's clear to me that building a consistent product people love correlates a company culture that values tech excellence. Ari Balogh, CTO at Airbnb, wrote the article ["Commitment to Craft"](https://medium.com/airbnb-engineering/commitment-to-craft-e36d5a8efe2a) and it captured my notion. I believe the pursuit of craft not only facilitates an individual's lateral and vertical growth, but also equips a company's economic growth. > Always learningüòé My curiosity took me on a wild ride in tech. - I started out wanting to make beautiful websites, and now I'm building packages, release pipelines, API gateways and services, and CLI applications. - I was trained to be an UX researcher, and now I'm doing performance monitoring and optimization, SEO, CDN deployments, and performance marketing. - I was told that I wasn't good enough, and now I'm mentoring, coaching, and sharing my learnings in the tech community. Commit to your craft. #### The resources about web architecture - [Is High Quality Software Worth the Cost?](https://martinfowler.com/articles/is-quality-worth-cost.html) by Martin Fowler - [AirbnbEng: Commitment to Craft](https://medium.com/airbnb-engineering/commitment-to-craft-e36d5a8efe2a) - [Domain Driven Design](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain-driven_design) - [Netflix Tech Blog](https://netflixtechblog.com) - [OSI Model](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/ddos/glossary/open-systems-interconnection-model-osi/) by Cloudflare - [System Design Interview ‚Äì An Insider's Guide](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/54109255-system-design-interview-an-insider-s-guide) by Alex Xu - [Tech at trivago](https://tech.trivago.com) - [The Airbnb Tech Blog](https://medium.com/airbnb-engineering) - [The System Design Primer](https://github.com/donnemartin/system-design-primer) - [Uber Engineering](https://eng.uber.com) - [Making Architecture Matter - Martin Fowler Keynote](https://youtu.be/DngAZyWMGR0) by Martin Fowler - [Learning SEO ‚Äì A Roadmap with Free Guides & Tools](https://learningseo.io) - [Akamai EdgeWorkers](https://developer.akamai.com/akamai-edgeworkers-overview) - [GitHub Actions](https://docs.github.com/en/actions) - [Synthetic & Real User Monitoring Explained](https://www.catchpoint.com/guide-to-synthetic-monitoring/rum-vs-synthetic-monitoring) by Catchpoint - [How Netflix Scales its API with GraphQL Federation (Part 1)](https://netflixtechblog.com/how-netflix-scales-its-api-with-graphql-federation-part-1-ae3557c187e2) by Tejas Shikhare #### The resources about languages - [JavaScript Allong√©, the "Six" Edition](https://leanpub.com/javascriptallongesix/read#leanpub-auto-about-the-author) by Reg ‚Äúraganwald‚Äù Braithwaite - [TC39 Proposals](https://github.com/tc39/proposals) - [V8](https://v8.dev) - [The Rust Programming Language](https://doc.rust-lang.org/book/) - [Learn Rust With Entirely Too Many Linked Lists](https://rust-unofficial.github.io/too-many-lists/) - [Rust by Example](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/rust-by-example/) ## Final Thoughts The potential in tech is limitless. Sometimes your journey might be tough, but don't be discouraged. There are so many amazing wisdom in books and articles within your reach to help you accomplish your vision. Let's get itüöÄ ## References #### Books - [15 Commitments of Conscious Leadership](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/23275060-15-commitments-of-conscious-leadership) by Jim Dethmer, Diana Chapman, Kaley Warner Klemp - [Atomic Habits: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/40121378-atomic-habits) by James Clear - [Daring Greatly: How the Courage to Be Vulnerable Transforms the Way We Live, Love, Parent, and Lead](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/13588356-daring-greatly) by Bren√© Brown - [Discover Your True North](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/25957932-discover-your-true-north) by Bill George, David Gergen (Foreword) - [Extreme Ownership: How U.S. Navy SEALs Lead and Win](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/23848190-extreme-ownership) by Jocko Willink, Leif Babin - [Grit](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/27213329-grit) by Angela Duckworth - [How Champions Think: In Sports and in Life](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/25305085-how-champions-think) by Bob Rotella, and Bob Cullen (Contributor) - [Inspired: How to Create Tech Products Customers Love](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/35249663-inspired?ac=1&from_search=true&qid=1o6CU5ZS61&rank=2) by Marty Cagan - [Mindset: The New Psychology of Success](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/40745.Mindset) by Carol S. Dweck - [No Rules Rules: Netflix and the Culture of Reinvention](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/49099937-no-rules-rules) by Reed Hastings, Erin Meyer - [Outliers: The Story of Success](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3228917-outliers) by Malcolm Gladwell - [On Writing Well: The Classic Guide to Writing Nonfiction](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/53343.On_Writing_Well) by William Zinsser - [Principles: Life and Work](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/34536488-principles) by Ray Dalio - [Quiet](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/8520610-quiet) by Susan Cain - [Radical Candor: Be a Kickass Boss Without Losing Your Humanity](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/29939161-radical-candor) by Kim Malone Scott - [The Rust Programming Language](https://doc.rust-lang.org/book/) by Steve Klabnik, Carol Nichols, with contributions from the Rust Community - [So Good They Can't Ignore You: Why Skills Trump Passion in the Quest for Work You Love](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/13525945-so-good-they-can-t-ignore-you) by Cal Newport - [System Design Interview ‚Äì An Insider's Guide](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/54109255-system-design-interview-an-insider-s-guide) by Alex Xu - [The Chimp Paradox: The Acclaimed Mind Management Programme to Help You Achieve Success, Confidence and Happiness](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/12228097-the-chimp-paradox) by Steve Peters - [The Headspace Guide to Meditation & Mindfulness](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/27414493-the-headspace-guide-to-meditation-mindfulness) by Andy Puddicombe - [The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up: The Japanese Art of Decluttering and Organizing](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/22318578-the-life-changing-magic-of-tidying-up) by Marie Kond≈ç - [The One Thing: The Surprisingly Simple Truth Behind Extraordinary Results](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/16256798-the-one-thing) by Gary Keller, Jay Papasan - [The Power of Habit: Why We Do What We Do in Life and Business](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/12609433-the-power-of-habit) by Charles Duhigg - [The Start-Up of You: Adapt to the Future, Invest in Yourself, and Transform Your Career](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/12030438-the-start-up-of-you) by Reid Hoffman, Ben Casnocha - [The Willpower Instinct: How Self-Control Works, Why It Matters, and What You Can Do to Get More of It](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/10865206-the-willpower-instinct) by Kelly McGonigal - [Trillion Dollar Coach: The Leadership Playbook of Silicon Valley's Bill Campbell](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/42118073-trillion-dollar-coach) by Eric Schmidt, Jonathan Rosenberg, Alan Eagle - [Why We Sleep: Unlocking the Power of Sleep and Dreams](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/34466963-why-we-sleep) by Matthew Walker #### Online Resources - [AirbnbEng: Commitment to Craft](https://medium.com/airbnb-engineering/commitment-to-craft-e36d5a8efe2a) - [Akamai EdgeWorkers](https://developer.akamai.com/akamai-edgeworkers-overview) - [Career Ladder](https://career-ladders.dev) by Sarah Drasner - [GitHub Actions](https://docs.github.com/en/actions) - [Cloudflare](https://www.cloudflare.com/) - [Domain Driven Design](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain-driven_design) - [Headspace](https://www.headspace.com/) - [How Netflix Scales its API with GraphQL Federation (Part 1)](https://netflixtechblog.com/how-netflix-scales-its-api-with-graphql-federation-part-1-ae3557c187e2) by Tejas Shikhare - [Huberman Lab](https://hubermanlab.com/) - [Is High Quality Software Worth the Cost?](https://martinfowler.com/articles/is-quality-worth-cost.html) by Martin Fowler - [JavaScript Allong√©, the "Six" Edition](https://leanpub.com/javascriptallongesix/read#leanpub-auto-about-the-author) by Reg ‚Äúraganwald‚Äù Braithwaite - [Learn Rust With Entirely Too Many Linked Lists](https://rust-unofficial.github.io/too-many-lists/) - [Learning SEO ‚Äì A Roadmap with Free Guides & Tools](https://learningseo.io) - [Making Architecture Matter - Martin Fowler Keynote](https://youtu.be/DngAZyWMGR0) by Martin Fowler - [Netflix Tech Blog](https://netflixtechblog.com) - [OSI Model](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/ddos/glossary/open-systems-interconnection-model-osi/) by Cloudflare - [Rust by Example](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/rust-by-example/) - [Synthetic & Real User Monitoring Explained](https://www.catchpoint.com/guide-to-synthetic-monitoring/rum-vs-synthetic-monitoring) by Catchpoint - [Tech at trivago](https://tech.trivago.com) - [The Airbnb Tech Blog](https://medium.com/airbnb-engineering) - [The System Design Primer](https://github.com/donnemartin/system-design-primer) - [TC39 Proposals](https://github.com/tc39/proposals) - [Uber Engineering](https://eng.uber.com) - [V8](https://v8.dev) --- Here you have it! Thanks for reading throughüôå If you find it useful, please share this article to help more people in their engineering journey. Feel free to connect with me on [twitter](https://twitter.com/dawchihliou)! My previous article ["Binary Tree Insertion in Rust"](/articles/binary-tree-insertion-in-rust) shared my struggle when I was implementing a Binary Tree. It took me some time to have a grasp on Rust's ownership. If you're interested in Unicode in Rust and JavaScript, I wrote an article ["Indexing Strings in Rust and TypeScript: A Case Study of String"](/articles/indexing-strings-in-rust-and-typescript). There we discussed how Rust and JavaScript handle strings with a classic algorithm. If you're interested in writing a CLI with TypeScript and implementing a real-world CLI application with Google Lighthouse integration, check out my previous article ["Writing Your Own TypeScript CLI"](/articles/writing-your-own-typescript-cli). Happy coding!

`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:`As I get more years under my belt, the bigger projects I'm involved in.

My focus turned to how to empower all parties involved to iterate and deliver fast, and at the same time be helpful in alignment on tech excellence.`}),`

`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:[`It's clear to me that building a consistent product people love correlates a company culture that values tech excellence.
Ari Balogh, CTO at Airbnb, wrote the article `,(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://medium.com/airbnb-engineering/commitment-to-craft-e36d5a8efe2a",children:'"Commitment to Craft"'}),` and it captured my notion.
I believe the pursuit of craft not only facilitates an individual's lateral and vertical growth, but also equips a company's economic growth.`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.blockquote,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"Always learning\u{1F60E}"}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"My curiosity took me on a wild ride in tech."}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.ul,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.li,{children:"I started out wanting to make beautiful websites, and now I'm building packages, release pipelines, API gateways and services, and CLI applications."}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.li,{children:"I was trained to be an UX researcher, and now I'm doing performance monitoring and optimization, SEO, CDN deployments, and performance marketing."}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.li,{children:"I was told that I wasn't good enough, and now I'm mentoring, coaching, and sharing my learnings in the tech community."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"Commit to your craft."}),`
